title: Save energy at home
description: Changing to LED lightbulbs, washing laundry in cold water, and hanging clothes instead of using the dryer can all help lower the usage of natural resources.

title: Walk, bike, or take public transport
description: For shorter distances walking or riding a bike will help with greenhouse emissions along with aiding in your health and fitness. For longer distances, consider riding the bus or train.

title: Eat more vegetables
description: Plant-based foods generally results in fewer greenhouse gas emissions and requires less energy, land, and water.

title: Consider your travel
description: When possible meet virtually, take a train, or skip long distance trips because airplanes burn large amounts of fossil fuels.

title: Throw away less food
description: When throwing away food it winds up in a landfill and produces methane which is a greenhouse gas. When buying food either use it or compost any leftovers.

title: Reduce, reuse, repair & recycle
description: To protect out climate, buy fewer things, shop second-hand, repair what you can, and recycle.

title: Change your home's source of energy
description: If possible see if your home can use renewable energy sources such as wind or solar.

title: Switch to an electric vehicle
description: In many countries, electric cars help reduce air pollution and cause fewer emissions than gas or diesel-powered vehicles.

title: Make your money count
description: To reduce your environmental impact, choose products from companies who use resources responsibly.

title: Speak Up
description: No one person can insight change but one person can inform others what they can do to help climate change.
